Rueil

Martha

Martha

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Easy (90%).  Mostly Luck.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.

 

•12 tableau piles (left of foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards in sequence down by alternate color may be moved as a unit.   Spaces can be filled by any single card (not a sequence).  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, alternating face up and face down.

Options

AutoPlay

History

This is a game of skill, related to Beleaguered Castle and Baker's Dozen.  It is easier than those games, however.

Similar Games

Stewart

Vineyard

Baker's Dozen

Beleaguered Castle

Twelve Piles

Matrimony

Matrimony

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Very Hard (1%).  Mostly Luck.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (top) - Build the top piles down in suit from Jacks to Ace, King, Queen.  Build the lower piles up in suit from Queens to King, Ace to Jack.   Each group of 4 piles should have a pile of each suit.
•16 tableau piles (below foundations) - top card is available for play on the foundations.  Spaces are not filled.  No building.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (top left, face down) - deal one card to each tableau pile, by clicking.  When the stock is empty, the tableau is redealt in the following way by clicking on the empty stock: the cards in the last pile of the last row are picked up and turned over.  The top card is dealt to the pile where the cards were taken, the remainder are dealt to the first pile in the first row and across until the cards run out.  This can be repeated for each pile in the tableau, moving from the bottom right pile to next pile to its left.  There are 16 redeals, one for each pile.

Options

AutoPlay

 

Notes

Because of the way the redeal is structured, if the pile that is to be redealt has 0 or 1 cards, nothing will happen.

Similar Games

Alliance

Maui Solitaire

Maui Solitaire

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.   At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt face down to each pile, then 6 cards face up.
•stock (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the waste by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

Notes

•Any card in the tableau may be built upon another, no matter how deep it is in a pile.  All cards covering it are moved together.

History

Maui Solitaire is a variation of Hawaiian Solitaire.

Similar Games

Hawaiian Solitaire

Yukon

Cornelius

Australian Patience

Maze

Maze

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Easy (>99%).  Skill.

Object

To create a sequence of 48 cards consisting of 4 12-card sequences from Two to King in suit, reading from left to right and top to bottom.  The far right card in a row is consecutive with the far left card in the next lower row.  The last card in the last row is consecutive with the first card in the first row.  The sequence may start anywhere and end anywhere and empty spaces within the sequence do not count.  The only thing that matters is a proper sequence of 48 cards.

Layout

•54 card spaces  - Fill in gaps (spaces) by moving the next highest ranking card in suit to the card to the left of the space into the space, or the next lower ranking card in suit to the card to the right of the space into the space.  A Two of a different suit can be played to the right of a King.  No card can be played to the left of a Two (unless there is a card to the left of the space, in which case a card of one rank higher than the card to the left may be played there). For example, if there is a 4♦ , then a space, then a 8♣, then either a 5♦ or a 7♣ can be played in the space.  The far right card in a row is consecutive with the far left card in the next lower row.  The last card in the last row is consecutive with the first card in the first row.   At the start of the game cards are dealt to 6 rows of 9 cards and the Aces are removed (the first 2 rows have an addition space at the end).  

History

Maze is a game of a type similar to Gaps.

Similar Games

Gaps

Spaces and Aces

McCarver

McCarver

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Fill spaces with any card or group of cards.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 to the 2nd, and so on.
•stock (bottom left, face down) - deal one card to each tableau pile, by clicking.  No redeals.

 

•2 cells (bottom) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each cell.  The card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

History

McCarver is the game Carlton with 2 cells.

Similar Games

Carlton

Carlton Cell

Old Carlton

Steve

McClellan

McClellan

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Hard (20%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down in suit. Groups of cards may be moved if they form a sequence down in suit.  Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, 3 face down, 1 face up.
•stock (bottom left) - turn over 1 card at a time to the waste pile by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

History

McClellan is a variation of Little Napoleon.

Similar Games

Little Napoleon

Forty Thieves

Microbe

Microbe

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To group all the cards in sets of 13 cards in sequence down by alternate color from King to Ace.

Layout

•11 tableau piles - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards in sequence down by alternate color may be moved as a unit.  A space can be filled by any card or legal group of cards, until after the stock is empty, when empty spaces can no longer be filled.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, alternating face down and face up.
•stock (top left, face down) - deals 1 card to each tableau pile by clicking.

Notes

•Whenever a sequence of 13 cards down by alternate color from King to Ace is formed, it will automatically be removed from play.
•During the initial deal, the 2 decks are separated.  The initial deal consists of 44 cards from the first deck. The stock then contains the remaining cards from the first deck plus the second deck.

Similar Games

Spider

Middle Gate

Middle Gate

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (85%).  Mostly Luck.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•6 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Empty piles are filled automatically from the reserves (or by  any card when the reserves are empty).  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•2 reserve piles (top, left and right of foundations) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.  At the start of the game 9 cards are dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (bottom, face down on left) - move 1 card to waste by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (beside stock) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Middle Gate is a game in between Gate and Little Gate invented by Thomas Warfield.

Similar Games

Gate

Little Gate

Canfield

Dutchess

Midnight Clover

Midnight Clover

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (45%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (left) - build up in suit from Ace to King.  At the beginning of the game, the Aces are dealt here.
•16 fans (beside foundations) - build down in suit.  Only one card at a time may be moved to the foundations or another fan, except that once per game a draw (or merci) is available.  Right-clicking on any buried card will move that card to the top of its pile.  This can only be done once in each game.  Spaces are filled only by Kings.  At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt face up to each pile.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Midnight Clover is a variation of Box Fan.  It was invented by Thomas Warfield.

Similar Games

Box Fan

Fan

Midnight Sun

Midnight Sun

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•7 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Fill spaces with any card or legal group of cards.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.
•8 fans (left) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau or other fans.  Build cards of same rank.  Spaces cannot be filled.  At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt face up to each pile.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Midnight Sun was invented by Thomas Warfield.

Similar Games

Willow

Fascination

Spike

Weeping Willow

Midshipman

Midshipman

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•9 tableau piles (below foundations) -   Build down in any suit but the same.  Only the top card of each pile may be moved.  Spaces filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, 2 face down and 2 face up.
•stock (top left) - turn over 1 card at a time to the waste pile by clicking.   No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

 

Options

AutoPlay

History

Midshipman is very similar to Maria.  The differences are that two cards in the original tableau are dealt face down, and the tableau is built down in any suit but the same, rather than down by alternate color.  It makes the game slightly easier to win.

Similar Games

Maria

Forty Thieves

Millennium

Millennium

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (35%).  Skill/luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (across top) - build up regardless of suit from Ace to King.
•4 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards can be moved as a unit if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Spaces can be filled by any card or legal group of cards.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.
•stock (top left, face down) -deals 1 card to each tableau pile by clicking.  No redeals.

 

History

Millennium is a variation of Alloway Kirk and Tam O'Shanter.

 

 

Similar Games

Alloway Kirk

Tam O'Shanter

Assembly

Millie

Millie

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Hard (15%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Empty piles can be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (top, face down on left) - deals one card to each tableau pile by clicking.  No redeals.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Millie is Miss Milligan, without the formality and reserve.

Similar Games

Miss Milligan

Milligan Cell

Milligan Cell

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Very Easy (98%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Empty piles can be filled by a King or a legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (top, face down on left) - deals one card to each tableau pile by clicking.  No redeals.
•4 cells (below stock) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each cell. The card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Milligan Cell is a variation of Miss Milligan that has some characteristics of FreeCell.

Similar Games

Miss Milligan

FreeCell

Milligan Harp

Milligan Harp

Milligan Harp

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (75%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.   Fill spaces with any card or group of cards.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 to the 2nd, and so on.  Only the top card of each pile is face up.
•stock (bottom left, face down) - deal one card to each tableau pile, by clicking.  No redeals.

History

Milligan Harp is a cross between the games Miss Milligan and Harp.

Milligan Yukon

Milligan Yukon

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (65%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.   At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face  upto the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.
•stock (top left, face down) - deal one card to each tableau pile, by clicking.  No redeals.

History

Milligan Yukon is similar to the games Milligan Harp and Yukon.

Minerva

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (25%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•7 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards with a King at the bottom.  At the start of the game a row of cards is dealt face down, another face up, another face down, and finally a row face up.
•stock (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time, by clicking.  One redeal.
•waste (next to stock) - top card available for play on the foundations or tableau.
•reserve (left of tableau) - Top card always available for play on the tableau or foundations.  At the start of the game 11 cards are dealt here.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Minerva is a variation of Athena and Munger.

Similar Games

Double Minerva

Triple Minerva

Munger

Athena

Klondike

Miss Milligan

Miss Milligan

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (30%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Empty piles can be filled by a King or a legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (top, face down on left) - deals one card to each tableau pile by clicking.  No redeals.
•reserve (below stock) - storage for a card or sequence of cards, usable only after stock is empty.  Card or sequence is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

Notes

After all cards in the stock pile have been played, players may take advantage of the empty space beneath the stock pile (the reserve).  Any single card, or legal sequence of cards may be moved to that space.  Only one such card or sequence may be played to the reserve.

History

Miss Milligan is a classic solitaire game that is very popular in England.

Similar Games

Mrs. Milligan

Imperial Guards

Carlton

Millie

Giant

Milligan Harp

Milligan Cell

Surprise

Miss Muffet

Miss Muffet

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Hard (4%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To group all the cards into 4 sets of 13 cards in sequence down in suit from King to Ace within the tableau.

Layout

•10 tableau piles - build down in suit, or in the same rank.  Groups of cards in sequence down in suit (or of the same rank) may be moved as a unit (groups moved as a unit cannot contain both cards descending in sequence and multiple cards of the same rank at the same time).  Spaces are filled by a King or a legal group of cards headed with a King.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt to each pile, except for the first and last piles which are dealt 6.

Notes

•The tableau piles are built down in suit, or in the same rank. That is, if the exposed card of a pile is the 7 ♠, the 6 ♠ or another 7 (such as the 7 ♥) may be played on it.

 

History

Miss Muffet is a variation of David Parlett's game Curds and Whey.  It was invented by Bill Taylor.

Similar Games

Curds and Whey

Monaco

Monaco

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Easy (94%).  Mostly Luck.

Object

To discard all the cards in pairs.

Layout

•25 Piles arranged in a 5x5 square - discard pairs of cards that add to 15 that are adjacent to each other, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally (to discard a pair, drop one of the cards on the other, or right-click on one of the cards). Discard Aces singly, by clicking on them.

Notes

•Pairs of cards that add to 15 are King-2, Queen-3, Jack-4, Ten-5, 9-6, 8-7.
•Whenever a pair (or Ace) is discarded, the remaining cards will be moved to the top in the following way: spaces are filled by moving cards to the left.  If there are spaces on a higher row, a card is moved from the leftmost pile of the lower row to the rightmost pile of the higher row.  New cards are dealt to fill the spaces at the bottom.  All the cards are moved in this way until all the spaces are at the bottom.

History

Monaco is a variation of Monte Carlo.  It was invented by Thomas Warfield.  It has the same layout as Monte Carlo, but cards are discarded in pairs that add to 15 rather than pairs of the same rank.  Also, spaces in the layout are filled immediately, rather than only when the fill button is presses, making for a more dynamic game.

Similar Games

Monte Carlo

Fourteens

Weddings

Monarch

Monarch

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•7 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down in suit.  Groups of cards may be moved regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or a group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.
•stock (top left, face down) -Deal one card to each tableau pile, by clicking.  No redeals.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Monarch is a harder version of Queenie was invented by Thomas Warfield.

Similar Games

Queenie

Yukon

Nunavut

Montana

Montana

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Very Easy (>99%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To create 4 sequences of 12 cards of the same suit, running from Twos to Kings.

Layout

•52 card spaces  - Fill in gaps (spaces) by moving the next highest ranking card in suit to the card to the left of the space into the space.  Do this by clicking on the card to you want to move.  At the start of the game 13 cards each are dealt to 4 rows and the Aces are removed.   The object is to rearrange the cards so that each row contains a in-suit sequence starting with Two on the far left and going up to Kings.
•Shuffle (top) - When clicked, all cards that are not in suit sequence starting from a Two in the leftmost position of the pile will be picked up and moved randomly to another location (that is, once a card is in a position it needs to be in to win the game, it will remain there thru a shuffle).  Two Shuffles are allowed (or select Unlimited redeals in Options).

Notes

•A gap (space) can be filled by moving the next higher card in suit to the card immediately to the left of the space into the space.  This is done simply by clicking on the card you want to move.   For example, if there is a 4 ♦ followed by a space, click on the 5 ♦ (wherever it may be) and it will be moved to the right of the 4.  Gaps (spaces) on the far left that have no card to the left can be replaced by Twos (of any suit).  When the card to the left of a gap is a King, no card can be moved into its place.
•Eventually, all the gaps will be to the right of Kings.  When this occurs, the cards can be reshuffled by clicking on the Shuffle indicated in the top center of the playing field.

Options

Rules - 2 ReDeals or Unlimited ReDeals

History

Montana is a variation of Gaps.  It differs from Gaps in how the spaces are placed after a shuffle.

Similar Games

Gaps

Spaces and Aces

Free Parking

Maze

Monte Carlo

Monte Carlo

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (55%).  Mostly Luck.

Object

To discard all the cards in pairs.

Layout

•25 Piles arranged in a 5x5 square - discard pairs of cards of the same rank that are adjacent to each other, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
•Fill button - when all available pairs are discarded, clicking the fill button moves the remaining cards up and deals new cards to the empty piles.

Notes

•When all available pairs have been discarded, click on the Fill button.  The remaining cards will be moved to the top in the following way: spaces are filled by moving cards to the left.  If there are spaces on a higher row, a card is moved from the leftmost pile of the lower row to the rightmost pile of the higher row.  New cards are dealt in the spaces until all cards in the deck have been dealt.

History

Monte Carlo is a pair-elimination game, like Nestor and Doublets.

Similar Games

Weddings

Monaco

Fourteens

Nestor

Doublets

Vertical

Moosehide

Moosehide

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (70%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•7 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down in any suit but the same.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.   At the start of the game 1 card is dealt the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.  Then 4 additional face up cards are dealt to the 2nd through 7th piles.

Options

AutoPlay

Notes

•Any face up card in the tableau may be built upon another, no matter how deep it is in a pile.  All cards covering it are moved together.  When a face down card is uncovered, it is automatically turned face up and is available for play.

History

Moosehide is a variation of Yukon.  It is slightly easier than Yukon.

Similar Games

Yukon

Russian Solitaire

Alaska

Morehead

Morehead

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (70%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top) - build up in suit from Aces to Kings.
•10 tableau piles - build down in any suit but the same.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are filled by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The 8th, 9th, and 10th piles all contain 8 cards.

History

Morehead is named after Albert H. Morehead, a solitaire writer and inventor.

Similar Games

Somerset

Raglan

King Albert

Morphy

Morphy

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (30%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top) - build up in suit from the rank of the first card moved to the first pile, wrapping from King to Ace as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards.
•10 tableau piles (below foundations) - build up or down by alternate color.  Only the top card of each pile is available for play.  Spaces may be filled by any available card.  At the start of the game 6 cards each are dealt to the first 2 piles, 5 cards each to the remaining piles.

Options

AutoPlay

Notes

•To begin the game, choose a card to move to the first foundation pile (far left at top).  All the other foundation piles will then begin with the same rank as this card.

History

Morphy is a variation of Chessboard.

Similar Games

Fortress

Chessboard

Lasker

Mount Logan

Mount Logan

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (20%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•6 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.   At the start of the game 1 card is dealt the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.  Then 5 additional face up cards are dealt to the 2nd through 6th piles, followed by a face up card to each pile.

Options

AutoPlay

Notes

•Any face up card in the tableau may be built upon another, no matter how deep it is in a pile.  All cards covering it are moved together.  When a face down card is uncovered, it is automatically turned face up and is available for play.

Tips

•Uncover the face down cards as soon as possible.  Don't let one foundation get too far ahead of the others.

History

Mount Logan is a variation of Yukon with one fewer tableau pile.  This makes it a somewhat harder game.

Similar Games

Yukon

Mount Olympus

Mount Olympus

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Very Easy (97%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•Odds foundations (top) - build up in suit by twos, starting with Aces. (Ace, Three, Five, Seven, Nine, Jack, King).  At the start of the game the Aces are dealt here.
•Evens foundations (under Odds) - build up in suit by twos, starting with Twos. (Two, Four, Six, Eight, Ten, Queen).  At the start of the game the Twos are dealt here.
•9 tableau piles (under Evens) - top card is available for play on the foundations.  Build down in suit by twos.  Groups of cards in sequence down in suit by twos may be moved as a unit.  Spaces are filled from the stock, when the stock is empty spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (left, face down) - Deals one card to each tableau pile by clicking.

Similar Games

Great Wheel

Zeus

Moving Left

Moving Left

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Hard (15%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations

Layout

•8 foundation piles (top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•10 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Spaces are filled automatically by the face up card or group of cards in the pile immediately to the right of the open space.  The rightmost pile, if empty, may be filled with a King or a legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.
•stock (top left, face down) - turn over cards one at a time to the waste, by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - Top card always available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Moving Left is a variation of Gargantua and Double Klondike.  The lack of redeals and the unusual method of filling empty spaces in the tableau make Moving Left considerably more challenging than those two games.  Moving Left originally appeared in a 1905 book by "Tarbart" under the name of Triangle.  The rules have been slightly modified by Thomas Warfield to make a better game.

Similar Games

Souter

Gargantua

Double Klondike

Single Left

Triple Left

Trigon Left

Different Left

Quadruple Left

Left Side Story

Rush Left

Mrs Mop

Mrs Mop

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (54%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all cards to the single foundation.

Layout

•1 foundation (top left, no cards) - all cards are built to this foundation, 13 cards at a time in King to Ace in suit sequences.
•13 tableau piles - build down regardless of suit.  Groups of cards in sequence down in suit may be moved as a unit.  A space can be filled by any card or legal group of cards.  At the start of the game 8 cards are dealt to each pile.

Notes

•Cards are moved to the foundation in groups of 13 cards, descending in sequence from King to Ace with all cards of the same suit.

Tips

•In suit sequences are preferred over any other kind of sequence.

History

Mrs. Mop is a distant relative of Spider.  It was invented by Charles Jewell (the inventor of Rouge et Noir).

Similar Games

Spider

Rouge et Noir

Lancaster

Mrs. Finn

Mrs. Finn

 Top  Previous  Next

4 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•16 foundation piles (across top, sides) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•9 tableau piles (below and between foundations) - build down regardless of suit.  Only the top card of each pile may be moved.  Empty piles can be filled only by a King.   At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (face down) - turn over cards one at a time to the waste by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (below stock) - Top card always available for play on the foundations or tableau.
•3 cells (left between foundations and tableau - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each cell.

 

Options

AutoPlay

History

Mrs. Finn is a 4 deck game similar to Miss Milligan.

Similar Games

Miss Milligan

Mrs. Four

Mrs. Four

Mrs. Four

 Top  Previous  Next

4 Decks. Hard (20%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•16 foundation piles (across top, sides) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•9 tableau piles (below and between foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Only the top card of each pile may be moved.  Empty piles can be filled only by a King.   At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (face down) - turn over cards one at a time to the waste by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - Top card always available for play on the foundations or tableau.
•3 cells (left between foundations and tableau - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each cell.

 

Options

AutoPlay

History

Mrs. Four is a harder version of Mrs.Finn.

Mrs. Milligan

Mrs. Milligan

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•8 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Empty piles can be filled by a King or a legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.
•stock (top, face down on left) - deals one card to each tableau pile by clicking.  No redeals.
•reserve (below stock) - storage for a card or sequence of cards.  Card or sequence is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Mrs. Milligan is a variation of Miss Milligan.

Similar Games

Miss Milligan

Imperial Guards

Mumbai

Mumbai

 Top  Previous  Next

3 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•12 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•13 tableau piles (below foundations) -  build down in any suit but the same.  Only the top card of each pile may be moved.  When a face down card is exposed in the tableau, the card is turned face up and becomes a "protected" card.        Protected cards may only be moved to a foundation and no cards may be played upon them.  When a protected card is moved to a foundation, the empty space will be filled from the stock with one face down card and two more face up (for as long as the stock contains the cards to do so).  Protected cards remain protected until the stock is empty, then they become available for play on other tableau piles, and other cards may be played upon them.  After the stock is empty, spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt to each pile, 1 face down and 2 face up.
•stock (top left) - turn over 1 card at a time to the waste pile by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - top card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.

 

History

Mumbai is a 3 deck variation of Indian Patience.

Similar Games

Indian Patience

Indian

Taj Mahal

Munger

Munger

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (33%)  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•7 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Spaces are filled by Kings or a legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, alternately face up and down.
•stock (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time, by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - Top card always available for play on the tableau or foundations.
•reserve (left of tableau) - Top card always available for play on the tableau or foundations.  At the start of the game 7 cards are dealt here.

Options

AutoPlay

Similar Games

Minerva

Klondike

Charlie

Muse

Muse

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (10%).  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (across top) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•9 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence down by alternate color and if there are enough free cells that the cards could be moved individually.   Spaces may be filled by any available card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.
•7 cells (below tableau) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each cell.  the card is available for play on the foundations or tableau.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.

Options

AutoPlay

History

Muse is a variation of King Albert.

Similar Games

King Albert

Mutual Acquaintance

Mutual Acquaintance

 Top  Previous  Next

2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Skill/Luck balanced.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•8 foundation piles (top) - build left 4 piles up regardless of suit from Ace to King, build right 4 piles down regardless of suit from King to Ace.  At the start of the game one Ace of each suit and one King of each suit are dealt here.
•8 reserve piles (below foundations) - cards are dealt here from the stock.  The top card of each pile is available for play.  Move cards to the foundations by clicking.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.
•stock (face down) - deal 1 card to each reserve pile by clicking.  One redeal.

History

Mutual Acquaintance is a two deck version of Acquaintance.

Similar Games

Double Acquaintance

Acquaintance

Auld Lang Syne

Sir Tommy

Mystique

Mystique

 Top  Previous  Next

1 Deck.  Medium (20%)  Mostly Skill.

Object

To move all the cards to the foundations.

Layout

•4 foundation piles (top right) - build up in suit from Ace to King.
•7 tableau piles (below foundations) - build down by alternate color.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence down by alternate color.  Spaces are filled by any card or legal group of cards.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, alternately face up and down.
•stock (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time, by clicking.  No redeals.
•waste (next to stock) - Top card always available for play on the tableau or foundations.
•reserve (left of tableau) - Top card always available for play on the tableau or foundations.  At the start of the game 9 cards are dealt here.

Options

AutoPlay

Similar Games
